summary.p: 9 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 41; Qurʾānic Text: Q 44:30-45:17; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 225 x 152mm; Script style: kūfī D.III.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
9 fol., 152×225 mm (1.48). Support: transparent parchment of yellowish color. Writing material: brown ink.
Collation: one incomplete quire, fol. 1 and 8, 3 and 6, 4 and 5 are bifolio, so used to be fol. 9 that has lost its other haf; fol. 2 and 7 are singletons with a stub.
I: H1F H2F S H3F H4F / F5H F6H S F7H F8H F9H

Text layout: 79×142 mm (1.8), 7 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D III. Diacritics: diagonal dashes, used only for letter ي on fol. 4r (2 times), 5v (3 times), 7v (1 time). Vocalization: large round red dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – rosette in gold and colors (type 3.1.2); for groups of five verses – medallions in the text line (type 1.A.II) in gold and colors with the inscribed word خمس, and on fol. 5r – letter ﻪ (hā) in gold (probably a mistake, as the number of the verse marked is not divisible by five); for groups of ten verses – medallions on the margins or in the text line (type 3.B.II) in gold and colors with the inscribed numbers of verses (ثلثون – fol. 1r, اربعون – fol. 3r, خمسون – fol. 4r, عشر – fol. 8r).
Title of surah 45 (الجاثية ثلثون وست) is written in gold and accompanied with large teardrop-shaped medallion on the outer margin drawn in gold and colors (fol. 5r).
Inscriptions: all the sheets have pencil marks with the surah numbers in Roman numerals and verse numbers in Arabic numerals.
Stitching: threads are preserved in the punctures of the fold.
Defects: stains; traces of moisture on fol. 8–9; ink peeling off on some pages.

Attached materials: old wrapping (fol. I) consisting of a narrow strip of paper with brief description of the manuscript in French in brown ink – “C E. \ 9 f. 7 lignes\ S. 44 v. 30 à la fin \ S. 45I v. I à 16” and old accession number in red pencil “B. 19”.
Old accession numbers: CE (on the wrapping); B. 19 (on the wrapping and according to Langlois’ inventory).
Fol. 1r–5r. Surah 44, verses 29(30) – 59(59)*. Incipit: [العذاب ا]لمهين * من فرعون إنّه.
Fol. 5r - 9v. Surah 45, verses 1(1) – 16(17). Explicit: بغيًا بينهم ا[نّ ربّك] ."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
